name: lulu
review: Wasn't worth the price, seemed unnecessary

name: Sara
review:
I just got this product, and I'm really gald I did! I have super-pale skin and most powders make my face a shade darker than my neck. This product is the perfect shade for my skin and blends well, however it probably will look chalky on darker skin tones. I noticed it did start to settle in creases and wear off slightly after a few hours, so reapplication is needed.
I actually liked the slight sparkle, I felt it gave my skin a nice dewy glow... but I can see how it could be an issue for some. If you hate the sparkles but otherwise like the product, I recommend Revlon's ColorStay powder in the translucent shade (it's basically the same minus the sparkles).

name: Alyssa
review: Great alternative to my MUFE translucent powder!

name: sbk
review: Loved to coverage and it lasted all day

name: Tray
review: This stuff is great! It helps control my oily skin throughout the day better than anything else I have tried so far and the translucent color is perfect for if you get a little darker with self tanner like I am using now it still works

name: Jkline72
review: I use this to set my under eye concealer. It works well into making it stay although I do feel like it does settle into the fine lines though after several hours but it does give you face a super soft finish that is nice

name: smj
review: this is a great finishing product--- I've spent alot more and have the same results with your product.

name: Lauren
review: Bought because I needed a matte translucent finishing powder, it doesnt say anything about freaking sparkles!!!! I put it on and It looks greasy and sparkly and ewww. So not good.

name: Aimi
review: This is without a doubt the best powder I have ever used. Controls shine because it sets the makeup so well. No change in color on skin - perfect!

name: Photoreadyskin
review: I bought this in hopes that it would help cover acne and dark spots left behind by acne, and I'm happy to say that it works wonders. I use a very small brush to tap a bit of this powder on problem spots only(to set the foundation I use first to cover any acne/blemishes). The shimmer in it is too much to use all over your face-just for blemishes.  I have very pale skin and when I do get a blemish it's very noticeable, until I use this to conceal it. And do people really expect the applicator that comes with any makeup to be great?  Come on.

name: nat
review:
personally didnt like this
it was sparkly, which i hated
it caked onto my skin
i suppose if your only going to use this when your going out and getting dolled up, it will photograph well. but it will make you look much whiter in pictures, so i recommend using a darker foundation than your usual color

name: *kennedy*
review: AWESOME!! It is a natural coat over the top to control shine and seal in your foundation. THANK YOU!! :)

name: Alex
review: This powder keeps my liquid foundation on from morning to night! It is easy to apply and doesn't mess up your makeup!

name: Dr. Sparkle
review: It does the job, but could be better.

name: Abby the Advanced Amateur
review: i use this product every day to finish off my foundation and it is amazing it give a good glow to my face and makes it look very natural and matte.

name: lucky815
review: pretty good.  compact is nice, includes a little brush

name: Kaki the Kutie
review: I am fair skinned so I know the translucent powder works on my skin. I like that I can powder it lightly on my face with my big powder brush easily.

name: lexi
review: I use this when I want an invisible finish. It also helps control unwanted shine from oily skin.

name: Honey2800
review:
I usually go for a more expensive product but I wanted to give this a try. It leaves a lovely matte, soft look. I am getting married Sept.22, 2012, we will see how this holds up to photography.
I can tell you it holds up to the Florida heat pretty good.

name: Nani
review: Better suited for people with fair skin and I have told my fair friends to get this product

name: Kysha
review: Use bit as an every day finisher, but i fubd it to be too sparkly.

name: Erin
review: This is one of my favorite products. I like the sparkles, since it is not applied heavily and it goes all over my face and isn't supper sparkly. I apply with big retractable face brush, which ensures good coverage. The brush included is not very useful. I am very fair and this product is a good shade for me, most powders are not a light enough. As a finisher it is good because it is not white, but a lighter flesh tone.

name: Erin
review: Love this powder! It is one of my faves. There are some sparkles, but I don't mind it since I don't put it on heavy. I am very fair, and most powders are not a light enough shade, so I don't have to worry about the color being too light. I wear it alone or over foundation.

name: kc
review: saw this recommended in a magazine and wanted to try.  I normally don't like to wear powder foundation but do need something to set my liquid foundation and this is perfect.It gives a nice finished look without being heavy.

name: Jenny bartender
review: Couldn't tell a difference when I put it on. Useless!

name: Makeup Lover
review: Use to set and blend eye shadow!!!!!!!

name: Merlynnie
review: I use this with Bare Minerals instead of the pricey Mineral Veil.  I have also used with Makeup Forever Powder Foundation and Revlon Colorstay liquid foundation.  Controls shine and sets my makeup very nicely.  I'm 45, fair skin and it doesn't settle into any lines I may have.  Stands up well to FL humidity.

name: Erin
review: I am very pale, so I have a hard time finding makeup that is light enough. I have red hair and green eyes, if that tells you anything! I apply this face powder with a big brush after mineral foundation and it is very natural-looking for me. It does not settle into my creases like most powders. It does have a slight glitter, but nobody is going to notice unless they are right in front of your face.

name: Sum One
review: I like this highlighter! I use the Revlon ColorStay (dry/normal) and I use this translucent powder to top it off! I actually apply this on top of the highlighter under my eyes and its the perfect last minute touch. Makes my face look brighter and ready for a photo and it captures light well in photos as well! The only real problem I have is that I realized there is glitter in it and I am usually strictly matte. You can't tell unless you look close up but it bothers me a bit. DO NOT put this all over your face, it will white you out. Obviously, it is white in color so its best to accentuate highlighting areas. It does cake up a bit if my skin is feeling particularly dry but I haven't noticed any huge problems. Overall, great stuff for the price!

name: Kate
review: Good setting powder

name: CherawGirl
review: I read good reviews about this but I have mature skin and don't need shimmer/sparkle to highlight age related imperfections.  Had to return it.

name: Sooner Gal
review: When my beauty blog recommended a finishing powder, I found this one and have used it ever since.  It is a true translucent and does not have a chalky finish.  It does just what it says.

name: Lauren the realist
review: Worked well for what I needed it for!

name: thill
review: Translucent powder is great for a technique called baking, a make up practice that helps create a flawless, long lasting make up look. Its supposed to look natural and keep the wearer's skin from looking oily. This powder has sparkles in it which, if you've ever had drop down from glitter eye shadow, you'll know how bad sparkles or glitter look on your cheeks and under your eyes. In my opinion any foundation based product should not have sparkles in it because it looks unnatural and will make your skin look oily.

name: Z
review: I like this translucent powder for setting my under eye concealer and it does prevent it from creasing on you. However, I usually will go for a very natural look and this powder has just too much sparkle in it. If you're going for a natural look then this probably won't be for you.

name: Teresa
review: I would buy this again.
I have very fair skin so it's hard to find a powder that is light enough, but this works/looks great! I will definitely be buying this powder again!

name: Outdoor Girl
review: My old translucent powder is no longer on the market so I tried this one.  Covers well, not cakey, doesn't add a pasty appearance.  Works great as a finishing powder over foundation or alone over sunscreen to even out skintone and minimize pores.  My only complaint is that it has a bit of shimmer to it, but not a lot.

name: Mimi
review: Apply under your eyes when you have highlighted them, apply over your concealer and over your eyes..

name: em
review: Love love love this for when I know I will be taking pics!

name: Vanessa
review: The only problem is there is a little flashback

name: kimmer
review: great coverage for a budget power

name: LC
review: I tried this against No7 Perfect Light Loose Powder for about a week. I tried them over concealer on both sides of my eyes, alternating sides incase one eye looks older than the other (not sure if that actually happens). Both are talc based and I've been told that's not good for the skin. Neither were the miracle look I've been looking for. Both settled into the lines beneath my eyes, which I swear I can't see until I start spackling all of this makeup beneath them. No 7 seemed to crease the worst. On the first day of the H2H I immediately noticed I liked better than No7 and I asked a few people which side of my face looked better. I did get rained on and I think No7 faired better than the Revlon but other than that, I thought Revlon had the better product and kept it. My search continues, though. All of these powders seem to sit under my eyes in a slightly more attractive way than if I had powdered sugar on but much less tasty. I bought some talc free options to try.

name: Kay
review: It works fine for coverage but DO NOT KEEP APPLYING OR BUILDING. YOU WILL LOOKS LIKE A GHOST! It is NOT TRANSLUCENT! It does have a little shimmer to it which is pretty but after reapplying over oily zones throughout the day I look like a ghost no matter how light I try to apply it. I have used it for setting powder a couple of times which is seems to work well for since it is actually very whitening/lightening when applied in a heavy application.

name: Cher
review: I didn't like the glitter in the powder. All falls in creases. I stopped using powder.

name: Kimmer
review: Makes a great almost airbrushed look to my skin.  I use a big fluffy brush so it gets l little messy but otherwise I love it.

name: KK
review: I really like this compact for use in my makeup bag.  Very portable without the mess of loose finishing powder.

name: A
review: I put it on as a setter.

name: jess
review: this is terrible, first of all the name of the product is very misleading considering its not translucent, it shows up white and it has SPARKLES. i desperately needed a setting powder so i bought this in a hurry not realizing there was sparkles. was not pleased with that, highlighter would be a much more appropriate name for this product.

name: melthenurse
review: I have big pores, I shine on my forehead all the time. The powder absorbs the oil and controls my shine as well as set my makeup. I do need to reapply during the day for continued shine control.

name: corrine
review: Great setting powder

name: Makeup Obsessed
review: I didn't like this at all. It was WAY too white, not translucent. It made me look like a ghost and i have a light to fair skin tone. I didn't like the sparkles it had in it. Overall, the only reason i use it now is to  dust it on over when i look orange because the extreme white color fixes it but it is way too white to be considered a translucent finishing powder. Don't waste your money.

name: Doctor Proctor
review: This product is okay.  I'm not really a huge fan.  It doesn't apply all that well, and I have oily skin, and it didn't prevent oil or  set my makeup very well.  It may work for shine control for people with normal to dry skin.

name: Sally K
review: This powder is okay, and what I mean is that it made my face look ghastly! Now mind you I dusted it on very lightly like I usually do with pigmented/foundation powders but it just made my skin look whiter than usual. It controls shine very well though, so as a whole it works like it says it does. Just watch out if your skin falls into the dark medium/caramel range.

name: Demi
review: I have oily skin and I live in a humid climate. This product is awesome. I don't have to keep checking my shine levels like I've always had to do with other products. Best of all, it's lightweight and natural-looking.

name: PopTart
review:
Pregnancy totally changed my skin, but not in the ways I'd hoped. My pregnancy "glow" was nothing but grease and oil. It was maddening. Since then, I've been on the look-out for a budget finishing powder to keep the shine at bay. This powder works! It also comes with the perfect, little application brush which works so much better than a sponge or poof.

For reference: I layer moisturizer, primer and liquid foundation.

name: Deev
review: This really sets your make up for the day.  My blush or highlighter doesnt move at all. For the price definitely can compete with other high end brands.

name: dragongal21
review: i use it to make my foundation matte.

name: Lisa
review: The product makes me look like a ghost, and I apply it very sparingly! I'll be giving this to a friend with WAY lighter skin tones.

name: rachel
review: im going to sound really negative but honesly i hate this product.. It makes me look so white, has sparkles, and in an hour im back to looking how i did before powder. This was a complete miss for revlon :(

name: Christina
review: Excellent powder finish. I use the Photo Finish foundation and concealer and I love them all. My skin is smooth and looks flawless. It last a long time and does help control oil. This product also helps with break out. I've tried a lot of powders and most of them agitate my acne prone skin and this one does not.

name: theprincessnooni
review: very good..soft and easy to use.[...] love it!!

name: Wren
review: This powder would have been fine if it were matte and didn't have little shimmers in it. Really, who wants to be shimmery?

name: BansheeBlue
review: I bought this for a movie/photo shoot to use with the Photoready foundation. I was suprised when I applied it that it had a very significant shimmer to it, and also, the application brush was small and plastic, and that made for an uneven and awkward application.

name: Brittkitten
review:
The product does eliminate shine, adds a nice matte look, and it isn't entirely translucent. The product does lighten my face after applying a little, but I have a medium complexion so it doesn't wash out my face completely.

I do not like the brush it came with, I only apply this using a thicker brush that has lighter and more secure bristles.

name: Felty
review: Works pretty well

name: R.B.
review: I have been using this product since it first came out & have never needed to look for any other powders because I am delighted with its performance. It's neutral, & perfect for any complexion. Just apply blush on cheeks & then lightly apply this finishing powder over your entire face.

name: B
review: I tried this product on the recommendation of a friend - I will purchase it again.  I am very fair skinned, and I use a mineral powder over moisturizer for all areas except under my eyes.  This is the product I use under my eyes.  Love it!

name: Missy
review: This works well. I like the silky feeling

name: Breezy
review:
Applicator is chincy... you'll be left with little black hairs after applying.

Description says "transluscent" which it is not. I am very fair skinned to begin with, but if I weren't careful with this stuff, I may start to reflect light.

name: Madison
review: Very light weight

name: B Diesel
review: Luminescent and lightweight powder that is ideal for my pale skin. It makes my skin glow and does not lie flat, like most other powders do. I would not consider this a true translucent powder for all skin tones.

name: Ellie
review: I went with the lightest and like the color.  So many are too dark for my fair skin.  It doesn't seem to last all day.  I'll go back to Cover Girl for 1/2 the price.

name: taylor
review: leaves a perfect matte finish without working about makeup lines

name: Michaela
review: it definitely leaves a visible white cast on your skin and looks powdery and unnatural. does control oil for a while but I wouldn't repurchase. I was especially disappointed because I love the normal Revlon photo ready powder.

name: Ap
review: Im not even medium complexion skin toned, and it makes your face appear fuzzy white or you could say 7 shades LIGHTER than the normal person. The only 'photo' you'll be 'ready' for is one with Casper- or if you decide "glow in the dark" is your preferred route- terrible product. Don't waste your money.

name: CatZelin
review: Use translucent color to keep make-up in place for several hours. For very oily skin, expect a few touch-ups throughout the day.

name: Bransona
review: I find that loose setting powders are too messy and tried this as a substitute. Pleasantly surprised! I've used this over my It Products for a while and it looks great!

name: Beekin
review: Perfect for daily use really is photo ready

name: Mom
review: Great lightweight product good to create a soft matte finish which is good for on camera work.  The translucent shade works well with my other products not adding color but a polished finish.

name: BellaMIa
review: I use it to brighten around my eyes. It works very well.
